Key Match Events: Jos√© Alvarado recorded three outs on seven pitches in a scoreless inning in a 3-2 Phillies win over the Tampa Bay Rays.
Alvarado induced a first-pitch foul out and then struck out Dylan Carlson on three heaters.
The Rays had three righty hitters to face Alvarado, who has struggled against them all season, and he passed.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Rob Thomson said Alvarado is 'just pitching free' and looks like the real Alvy.
Nick Castellanos said Alvarado's stuff is as good as anybody in baseball when he's confident and attacking the zone.
Post-Match Reflections: Alvarado said he's never given up and his mentality is just going out and competing and not worrying about things he can't control.
He added that it's all different when you go out and not think about those things, and now he knows what to do and who he is.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Alvarado hung two Cleto Reyes red boxing gloves in his locker, which were a gift from a friend.
He has a refreshed outlook on life and said it all seems like the best thing in the world when you're on the best team in baseball with the best record in baseball and the best teammates in baseball.
